title: RAM Dump Analysis
description:
You're analyzing a Windows memory dump using Volatility 3. To find running processes, you use:

$ python3 vol.py -f memory.dmp windows.pslist

The output shows a suspicious process:

PID    PPID   Name              CreateTime
4      0      System            2026-01-15 10:00:00
588    4      smss.exe          2026-01-15 10:00:01
1337   588    nc.exe            2026-01-15 14:22:33
2048   1024   explorer.exe      2026-01-15 10:01:00

Which process is suspicious, and what is its PID?

Submit as: flag{process_name_pid} (e.g., flag{cmd.exe_1234})
hints: nc.exe is netcat — a networking utility often used for reverse shells
PID 1337 (leet) is a red flag, and nc.exe shouldn't be spawned by smss.exe
Legitimate Windows processes are System, smss.exe, explorer.exe — nc.exe is not standard
